title: Riot, why does Lee Sin still have 350 base MS? It just lowers his skill requirement.
body:
350 MS lets him super-easily run up to someone, point-blank Q or E them, and reposition too easily for kicking you back toward his team. Where's the "requires skill" part of that?

Lee Sin has too much base movement speed for someone with so many damn dashes. LOWER IT.

EDIT: To put it in context, think of it this way - Lee Sin is almost never a bad pick for any composition. In any team line-up, he can have a use. No one really outclasses him at that.

Okay I used to main Lee Sin on my other account when I mostly played jungle and I can tell that Lee Sin is by far one of the most balanced champions in the game. He is useful in every meta and he is never unplayable. Every champion should be exactly like that. Champions like Zyra are not playable cause the game has gotten too fast, champions like Yorrick are useless against all those mobile champions etc.

Lee is overloaded that is true but that does not make him op. He needs a high movement speed to stick with his target when he can't land his q. He needs to aa his targets to not run out of energy and sometimes it is hard to reach them without using either just your q or w/e. 

Taking 10 of his movementspeed would not change that much. I still don't get why people cry about Lee. Elise was hella broken and here nobody said something. Fiora? Veigar? Lux? Brand? They all are obnoxious to deal with while being ten times easier than Lee is.

I think you pointed out the problem people have with Lee. 

>He is useful in every meta and he is never unplayable. 

While I agree it would be great if every champion were like this, as you pointed out it is not true. People get frustrated with the fact that Lee is ALWAYS a good solid pick. The question is, why are other champions only allowed to stay strong in one meta (Sej in Cinderhulk as an example) but Lee is allowed to stay strong in all of them? After a while people start to ask "why is Lee allowed to __". It seems to some to be favouritism (and truth be told Riot has basically said this).

Lee Sin has received love taps in the past, but they've barely changed him at all. Of course, it's expected for the generalist to not be as good at other roles champions can do, but he just has SO MUCH in his power budget that it seriously makes you wonder why it's been like this for SO LONG.

When a generalist like Lee comes along, he is supposed to have the same power budget as other champions, but it be divided into smaller categories (I.e. he can have the traits you described other champions who are (supposed to be) doing his job better). When Lee has this much stuff, all of it has to be relatively weak to keep his power budget equalized with others.

This hasn't really been the case. Just to give you an idea, at level 18, he is capable of doing 340 + (180% Bonus AD) + (8% missing health) in physical damage just from Q and follow-up, then his E does 200 + (+100% bonus AD) and also a 60% slow on follow-up. Finally, he can ult for 600 + (200% bonus AD), which also gives one of the most powerful knockbacks in the game. That's 1140 + (480% bonus AD) + (8% missing health) in the span of about 1.5 seconds. This is also not counting the fact he has 2 gapclosers and 350 base movespeed, which can keep up with or outrun every champion except Gnar (mini, at level 18), Elise (spider), Master Yi, and Pantheon. And most players build him tanky, not to mention.

I'm not saying that he's the worst champion ever made, but something HAS to go. Like, seriously, I'm not sure how this kit is allowed to function the way it is

There's no "basically" about it. 

Riot has stated outright they show Lee Sin blatant favoritism. Morello has on more than one occasion professed he knows Lee Sin is overloaded and overpowered but isn't allowed to nerf him.

Lee Sin players need to pull their heads out of their asses and stop ***PRETENDING*** he's a balanced champion just because he's not getting the nerfs he needs. He's not getting turned into a ***reasonably*** outfitted champion because he's *popular* and for **NO OTHER REASON**. Period. This is a 5 year old argument and it's been stated multiple times by Riot that they *would* change him if his whiney little fanboys didn't cry an ocean at any changes to him that aren't buffs.
